name: Components: Map (Regional scale)
description: A family class for games where the map is a region of a country

name: Components: Multi-Use Cards
description: The cards can be used in several different ways, and you have to choose one: eg use it as a resource or as an action Examples: San Juan, One deck Dungeon, Oh my goods. As the basis of deckbuilders is to use cards to buy other cards, those games are not included here

name: History: Industrial Revolution
description: Games (expansions, promos, etc.) featuring the Industrial Revolution in theme or gameplay. The Industrial Revolution period (end of 18th and beginning of 19th centuries) and the development of the industries.

name: Country: England
description: Games (expansions, promos, etc.) featuring the country of England in theme or gameplay. See also: Country: Great Britain (1707-1800) Country: United Kingdom (1801-now) Country: Wales Country: Scotland Country: Northern Ireland

name: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada
description: Games (expansions, promos, etc.) associated with The Game Artisans of Canada. (They are not a publisher, but an independent organization.) The Game Artisans of Canada is a group of Canadian Game Designers and Enthusiasts who pool their intellectual resources to make boardgame designs better. The Artisans collaborate through all available means in order to playtest and critique boardgame designs, offer advice to boardgame designers, and render assistance to members in finding publishers for their designs. The Game Artisans of Canada is a game foundry, forge, and refinery with a positive reputation amongst discerning players of games. It strives to make certain its members not only approach publishers with polished designs but that their designs have a strong chance of publication. The collective has built a respected brand, known by publishers and gamers alike.

name: Digital Implementations: VASSAL
description: There are many games available to play via VASSAL Engine. While it does not enforce strict observance of rules, it does allow pieces to be represented like they would be in a physical game. This is primarily a method used by wargamers

name: Digital Implementations: Tabletopia
description: Tabletopia is a digital sandbox system for playing board games with no AI to enforce the rules. Just read the rulebook, choose a seat at the virtual table, and let the game begin! https://tabletopia.com

name: Digital Implementations: Steam
description: Board games that have been (re)implemented on the Steam platform. This may includes games that run on Windows and/or MacOS and/or Linux.

name: Cities: Birmingham (England)
description: Games that feature Birmingham prominantly in the theme or gameplay. Birmingham is a city in England. It is England's second city, the most populous place with city status in the United Kingdom, and the largest city commonly known as Birmingham.

name: Theme: Canals
description: Games (expansions, promos, etc.) relating to Canals, in theme or gameplay. Canals are waterways channels, or artificial waterways, for water conveyance, or to service water transport vehicles. They may also help with irrigation. It can be thought of as an artificial version of a river. Canals carry free surface flow under atmospheric pressure. Source: Wikipedia, "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canal," available under the CC-BY-SA License.
